source_sentence: 欲得令人愛敬法成就最勝法。
translation: He wants to attain the most excellent teaching that inspires respect for the Dharma.
He wants to become well-versed.

source_sentence: 欲得成就一切呪法聰明。
translation: He wants to achieve intelligence in all incantations and teachings.

source_sentence: 欲得禁破他法禁水火一切毒。
translation: He wants to be able to prohibit the refutation of other things and prohibit all poisons of water and fire.
He wants to extinguish all the poisons, medicines, and worms.

source_sentence: 作一切法誦此呪大心呪即得成就。
translation: He'll achieve them all by reciting this great mental mantra.
Those who haven't known this Dharma before ...
He mustn't give it to them.
If he recites it wholeheartedly, he'll give it to them.
If you crudely chant it, you mustn't give it to him.
If he really conducts himself with energy, he'll give it to them.
If he deceives others, he mustn't give it to them.

source_sentence: 若實語無諂曲柔軟心行平等信受愛供養。
translation: If he speaks truly without flattery, is gentle, has an equal heart, conducts himself with faith, accepts it, and loves offerings.
Only such a person can transmit it.
If he doesn't, don't transmit it.
Next, he'll explain another spell separately.
He mustn't give it to anyone.
This is a teaching that requires death and shared death.
It mustn't be given to another person.

source_sentence: 或餘人有好法相換者與。
translation: Perhaps another person has a good teaching to exchange with him or her, and they give it to him or her.

source_sentence: 或復他人承事供養者與。
translation: Perhaps another person makes an offering to another person's service, and he gives it to them.
Or he may give a lot of treasures to others.
These three kinds of people are united in attaining this Dharma.
Why is that?
It's because they won't be stingy [e.g., [yi-tai+(humerus-moon)].

source_sentence: 此法金剛軍荼利大祕密心法。
translation: This is the great esoteric mental teaching of Vajragundaṭṭhita.
It's bestowed by the buddhas.
It's respected by all the gods.
It purifies and removes all kinds of sins.
It destroys all the crimes of Vairocana and the gods.

source_sentence: 藥叉羅剎比里多毘舍遮宮槃荼布怛那羯吒布怛那縕摩陀塞幹陀摩底里迦拏摩底里誐拏眾之所恭敬。
translation: He's respected by all the Yakṣa Rāṣa Bhīritas, Vaiśeṣika Palabharṇa, Pūtanakamṭa, Pūtanakauśalya, Mātrikāṇa, and Mātrikāṇa.
This mantra's adherence obtains great merit.

translation: Suppose good men and good women recite it, retain it, and make offerings to it.
They write it themselves, teach others to write it, and place offerings in their homes.
Perhaps they place it in their homes, or they may place it on a property.
They might place it on a property or in a mansion.
Or they might place it in one of the six animal husbandry places.
Or they might place them in an araṇya.
Or it might be placed in a mountain retreat or under a tree.
They'll always make offerings.
They will all be safeguarded.
All places will be made abundant.
All the necessities of life will be filled.
They'll be placed in an elder's house.
All illnesses and pains won't reach them.
Nor will they be attacked by insane ghosts.
Fire can't burn them, and they can't drown in water.
Water can't drown them.
Thieves can't steal it.
The king can't take it.
All of his many illnesses will never be numerous.
He'll win arguments with his mouth and tongue.
They'll increase their merit immeasurably.
They'll be born with the knowledge of their past lives.
After his life ends, he'll be born in the heavens.
They'll never part from the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 得大富貴聰明智惠長命。
translation: They'll attain great wealth, intelligence, wisdom, and wisdom for a long life.
They'll attain the respect of all [sentient beings].
They'll have abundant strength of form.

source_sentence: 一切資生之物常得饒益。
translation: All the things that support life will always be for their benefit.
Their slaves, servants, and servants are numberless and tens of millions.
The king pays respect to them.

source_sentence: 若人受持讀誦書寫供養。
translation: Suppose someone accepts, reads, recites, writes, and makes offerings to him.
He'll attain this measureless merit.

source_sentence: 若有長者商主豪貴婆羅門剎利有灌頂者。
translation: Suppose there's an elder, a merchant, a wealthy, powerful, Brahman, or a warrior who has a consecration.
They'll believe in and respect this teaching.

source_sentence: 供養如前壇品所說入三昧耶。
translation: He makes offerings as described in the previous section of the altar and enters samaya.

source_sentence: 此等人得無量功德說不可盡。
translation: Such a person will attain measureless merits that are inexplicable.

source_sentence: 一切諸佛菩薩之所攝受。
translation: They'll be taken in by all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.
They attain irreversibility, abhidharma, and so forth.
They're embraced by all the buddhas they see in person.
They attain vigorous exertion.
All enemies can't harm him.
The adamantine bodhisattva always chases after those who practice.

source_sentence: 一切諸天鬼神常當營衛。
translation: All gods and spirits will always guard him.
He'll attain great wealth and prosperity.
The vows his mind seeks will be fulfilled.
It's as explained above.
All functions praise him.
The person who precepts it should attain...

source_sentence: 一切諸天鬼神等信受奉行。
translation: All the gods, spirits, and so forth believed, accepted, and handed it down.

source_sentence: 西方陀羅尼藏中金剛族阿蜜哩多軍吒利法一卷時以大唐長慶元年十二月三十日於青龍東塔院比丘海雲寫記奉阿闍梨教以記他時并勘畢　(大正元年八月十二日依田中光顯伯爵所藏海雲自筆原本書寫加一校了　知心居士大村西崖)
translation: One volume of the Jingang family Amṛtakuṭṭaliputra from the Western Dhāraṇī Canon was written down by Bijuju at the Qinglong East Pagoda Hall on the 30th day of the 12th month in the first year of Changqing in the Great Tang Dynasty, in order to record the teachings of Ajātaśatru and to record the completion of other times.
